intro: Cryptantha corollata subsp. rattanii, commonly known as rattanii cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has small, oval leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. This subspecies is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
